business.headline: India's retail inflation dips to 4.31% in JanuaryThe country's retail inflation witnessed a drop in January majorly due to declining food prices.

Sensex, Nifty recover sharply but end in red; M&M falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex settled 122.52 points lower at 76,171.08. Earlier in the day, the 30-share index had plunged 850 points. Nifty, too, recovered strongly to end 26.55 points lower at 23,045.25.

Mutual fund inflows see slight dip in January. Here's whyThe flows declined 3.6% month-on-month to 396.88 billion rupees ($4.57 billion) from 411.56 billion rupees in December 2024, according to data by the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI).

New Income Tax Bill to introduce simpler 'tax year' concept: All you need to knowWhen the Income Tax Act of 1961 came into being it had 880 pages. Over the years, the act contained several amendments introduced in the various budgets.

Stock market bloodbath: Should buy the dip, exit or stay invested? The stock market correction has particularly hit retail investors, many of whom are contemplating selling their holdings at a loss. But is that the right move?

After 90-hour workweek remark, L&T chief stirs work-from-home debateThis is not the first time that the L&T Chairman's remarks have sparked a debate.  Earlier, he advocated a 90-hour workweek, which drew huge criticism.

Will retail inflation cool down further in January? Here's all you need to know The RBI mentioned continued reduction in rice prices and sharp corrections in the prices of vegetables, especially in the prices of onions, potatoes and tomatoes, in its January 2025 Bulletin.

L&T chief stirs fresh row with remark on labour crisis: Workers unwilling to moveSpeaking at CII's Mystic South Global Linkages Summit 2025 in Chennai, Subrahmanyan spoke about the difficulties faced by the construction industry in hiring and mobilising workers.

Sensex falls 700 points: 4 reasons why stock market is falling todayStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex plunged over 850 points before trimming some losses, trading 748.13 points lower at 75,545.47 by 10:23 am. The NSE Nifty50 also slipped nearly 1%, reflecting weakness across broader markets.
Sensex tumbles over 850 points as US tariff fears spook Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex nosedived 834.39 points to 75,459.21 at 10 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 251.95  points to trade at 22,819.85.

Madhya Pradesh: Rs 1,553 crore for Ladli Behna Yojana released. Check eligibilityLadli Behna Yojana aims to improve women's well-being, health, nutrition and economic independence. Presently, Rs 1,250 per month is given to all the eligible women under this scheme.

8th Pay Commission: Will its implementation face delays?Despite several measures announced for taxpayers in the Union Budget 2025, there was no mention of the financial impact of implementing the 8th Pay Commission.

Are you eligible for fixed medical allowance under NPS? Check details Retired central government civilian employees who are covered under the National Pension System will now be eligible for fixed medical allowance, announced the Department of Pension & Pensioners' Welfare.

Sensex ends 1,000 points lower: 5 factors behind today's stock market crashInvestors lost nearly Rs 10 lakh crore as selling pressure intensified across sectors due to various factors that dampened investor sentiment.

Sensex falls 1,000 points, investors lose Rs 10 lakh crore on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked by 1,1018.20 points to end at 76,293.60, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 309.80 points to close at 23,071.80.

India's inflation likely to dip to a 5-month low of 4.60% in January: ReportThe country's consumer inflation is expected to fall to a five-month low of 4.60% in January 2025, as compared to 5.22% which was recorded in December last year, as per Reuters.

India to keep ban on Chinese investments for now, says Chief Economic AdviserSpeaking at an event in Mumbai on Tuesday, Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) V. Anantha Nageswaran said that any changes to the current restrictions would take time and require a deeper understanding between both countries.

Coimbatore company rewards employees with Rs 14.5 crore bonus. Here's whyA few days ago, the CEO, Saravana Kumar, formally announced the release of the bonus. He shared that he deliberately did not choose to offer employee stock options (ESOPS) or performance-based incentives.

Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia critisises Aadhaar and UPI in a podcast Sabeer Bhatia mentioned that the use of video and voiceprint technology for the Aadhaar project, which is already embedded in smartphones, could have been a better approach which could have achieved the same results at much lower costs.

Not Mumbai or Bengaluru, this Indian city leads in luxury home price surgeMumbai, traditionally known for its expensive real estate, was placed seventh in the global rankings for luxury home price surge.

entertainment.headline: Samay Raina's show in Gujarat cancelled amid India's Got Latent controversyComedian Samay Raina's Gujarat shows have been cancelled following a controversy sparked by the latest episode of his show, India's Got Latent. The decision comes amid backlash after a distasteful comment by YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia on the show.

Sakamoto Days: With ex-assassin's potential match, the anime is raising stakesSakamoto Days follows the story of a legendary assassin who transforms into a family man. Now, with the introduction of an equally formidable enemy, the anime might finally pick up pace and raise the stake.
Aashram 3 Part 2 teaser: Bobby Deol's comeback as Baba Nirala promises more twistsAashram 3 Part 2 teaser is out. The upcoming riveting crime drama marks the return of Bobby Deol as Bala Nirala.

Anupamaa actor Gaurav Khanna opens up on being colour-blind on Celebrity MasterchefTV actor Gaurav Khanna appeared on Celebrity MasterChef where he opened up about being colour-blind. He participated on the show along with Ayesha Jhulka.

BTS' V named world's most handsome man. Hrithik Roshan, Brad Pitt also on listBTS singer V aka Kim Taehyung has been named as the world's most handsome man. The list also features Indian actor Hrithik Roshan, Hollywood stars Brad Pitt, Tom Cruise, Bradley Cooper, among others.

Picture This trailer: Simone Ashley, Hero Fiennes to headline new romantic comedyThe trailer for Simone Ashley and Hero Fiennes Tiffin's film, Picture This, has been unveiled. It will release on Prime Video on March 6.

Jackson Wang announces MAGIC MAN 2 – A raw and vulnerable chapterJackson Wang is set to release MAGIC MAN 2, an album that delves into the stages of grief and personal growth. After a year of introspection, he presents a raw and authentic portrayal of his journey.

Pop girl group XG take their 'The first HOWL' World Tour to Latin-America  XG, a dynamic hip-hop/R&B-inspired girl group, is set to captivate audiences in Latin America with their inaugural concerts in Brazil and Mexico. As they continue their world tour, XG unveils a groundbreaking project, 'XDM Unidentified Waves,' that redefines their music and solidifies their global appeal.

Singer Liam Payne was struggling with sexuality, coerced ex to abort: ReportA new report reveals late One Direction star Liam Payne struggled with his sexuality and allegedly pressured ex-fiancée Maya Henry to terminate a pregnancy.

Mukesh Khanna on Ranveer Allahbadia row: Blacken his faceActor Mukesh Khanna has criticised YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia for making explicit remarks on Samay Raina's show, calling for strict punishment to deter such behaviour.

Munawar Faruqui to Vir Das, comedians who landed in trouble for inappropriate jokesAs podcaster Ranveer Allahbadia faces backlash for his obscene jokes on an episode of India's Got Latent, here's a look at other stand-up comedians who have found themselves in trouble.

Diddy allegedly 'drugged and raped' a man, claims new lawsuitMusic mogul Sean Combs is embroiled in fresh legal trouble as an anonymous plaintiff files a sexual assault lawsuit against him in New York.

The phone dropped...: Story of Jitendra Kumar's humility and unassuming successActor Jitendra Kumar, popularly known as Jeetu Bhaiya, says the bigger thing is not to decide whether to take a risk in life or not, but to know what is at stake.

Arunachal women panel condemns Elvish Yadav's 'racist' remarks against Chum DarangThe Arunachal Pradesh State Commission for Women has condemned Elvish Yadav's derogatory remarks against Chum Darang and has demanded strict action. The comments have sparked backlash.

Kadhalikka Neramillai: Nithya Menen, Ravi Mohan's rom-com now streaming on NetflixKadhalikka Neramillai, the heartfelt romantic film, starring Nithya Menen and Ravi Mohan is streaming on OTT. The Tamil film had its theatrical release on January 14.

Suzhal The Vortex Season 2 to premiere on Prime Video this monthA brand-new season of the Tamil Prime Video series, Suzhal: The Vortex, was announced on Tuesday. The show will begin streaming on the OTT platform from this month itself.

Squid Game 3 to have 6 episodes. Fans say 'they better be 2 hours long'Fans of Squid Game are eagerly awaiting the third season. However, the revelation of the season having only six episodes has left many fans disappointed.

Solo Leveling Season 2: Animation peaks as Jinwoo defeats dungeon bossThe latest episode of Solo Leveling peaked with its brilliantly animated fight sequence. In the episode, titled Don't Look Down on My Guys, Sung Jinwoo clashed with Karlgargan.

Uorfi Javed defends friend Samay Raina amid calls for his arrestUorfi Javed slammed people demanding jail time for YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia and comedian Samay Raina after Allahbadia's obscene joke on India's Got Latent went viral.

Samay Raina in Seattle as India's Got Latent and Ranveer Allahbadia face backlashIndian stand-up comedian Samay Raina recently performed in Seattle, as controversies surrounding Ranveer Allahbadia and India's Got Latent stirred social media discussions in India.

general news.headline: PM Modi, Macron interact with Indian community as Marseille gets new consulate Live UpdatesPM Modi inaugurated a new Indian consulate in Marseille with French President Emmanuel Macron. The two leaders interacted with the Indian community and also visited the Mazargues War Cemetery to honour the sacrifice of Indian soldiers.

His Delhi politics: Uddhav Sena fumes as Sharad Pawar felicitates Eknath ShindeNCP founder Sharad Pawar had a rare praise for Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister and Shiv Sena chief Eknath Shinde, complimenting his inclusive approach to governance. However, the Shiv Sena (UBT) is said to be upset over Pawar's gesture.

Soldier killed in Jammu terror attack was weeks away from getting marriedNaik Mukesh Singh Manhas, along with Captain Karamjit Singh Bakshi, were killed when they were on patrolling duty near a forward post along the LoC in J&K.

Ranveer Allahbadia, Samay Raina row: Why gaali boys might escape obscenity lawsComics and YouTubers, including Ranveer Allahbadia and Samay Raina, have been booked in two states and charged with obscenity. In this context, it is interesting to revisit a Supreme Court verdict of March 2024 in the College Romance case. In that case, the SC made a clear distinction between obscenity and obscene language.

Brave escape from British ship links Savarkar to France's MarseilleIn 1910, while VD Savarkar was being transported to India as a British political prisoner, he made a daring escape from the Morea that was docked in the French port city of Marseille. The freedom fighter believed he could seek asylum on French soil. However, he was swiftly captured and handed over to the British. The episode triggered a diplomatic row between France and Britain, and is still debated.

3rd ODI LIVE: Salt, Duckett off to another aggressive start in AhmedabadIndia (IND) vs England (ENG), 3rd ODI Live updates from Ahmedabad: Phil Salt and Ben Duckett are once again off to an aggressive start in the ODI series. Both Harshit Rana and Arshdeep Singh are being punished in the first powerplay. Earlier, India rode on Shubman Gill's century to hit a huge total of 356 runs.

'India's Got Latent' not scripted, reaction was natural: Apoorva Mukhija to copsApoorva Mukhija, who had also come under criticism along with YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia over vulgar and crass remarks on the show, recorded her statement with Mumbai Police.

Kerala ragging horror: Beaten for months, dumbbells hung from private partsFive third-year students of a nursing college in Kottayam, Kerala, were arrested after a formal police complaint was filed against them, detailing a series of violent acts of ragging.

Ranveer Allahbadia's rumoured girlfriend shares cryptic post amid breakup buzzThe internet is buzzing with speculation that Ranveer Allahbadia and his rumoured girlfriend, Nikki Sharma, have called it quits.

Why chai-samosa won't go easy on your pocket at the airportCould the government intervene? Certainly. Would it? Unlikely. The 'argument': airports are commercial spaces where businesses can freely charge what the market can bear

Supreme Court criticises freebies culture during polls: People not willing to workThe observations came from a bench of Justices B R Gavai and Augustine George Masih which was hearing a matter concerning the right to shelter of homeless persons in urban areas.

No strict schedule, only smart study: Rajit Gupta on 100 percentile in JEE MainRajit Gupta, who bagged 100 percentile marks in JEE Main, credits happiness, smart study, and strong fundamentals for his success. He is now aiming for a high score on JEE Advanced.

Scared Ram Charan may have a girl again: Chiranjeevi slammed for sexist remarksActor Chiranjeevi drew criticism over his 'sexist' remark about wanting a grandson to continue his family's legacy. The South megastar said he is scared his son Ram Charan might have a daughter again.

Unnatural sex by man with wife without her consent not an offence: High CourtSexual intercourse between a husband and his wife, who is not below 15, cannot be termed as rape as the absence of the woman's consent for an unnatural act loses its importance, the Chhattisgarh High Court said.

New Income Tax Bill to introduce simpler 'tax year' concept: All you need to knowWhen the Income Tax Act of 1961 came into being it had 880 pages. Over the years, the act contained several amendments introduced in the various budgets.

Jail for a joke? Why Ranveer Allahbadia and his remark are best left with sip of beerPodcaster Ranveer Allahbadia and comedian Samay Raina are facing backlash for a joke on India's Got Latent. While outrage is fine, should there be legal ramifications of their 'joke'?

What is Mumtaz Hotel that Tirumala seers are up in arms against Seers of Tirumala Tirupati have gone on hunger strike to protest against the Mumtaz Hotel project near the sacred seven hills. They say it will violate the sanctity of the shrine. This is more about the 5-star hotel project and why it has kicked up a storm.
Electric car sales are rising in India. Can they double in 2025?The electric car sales in India rose 19.93% to 99,165 units in 2024 from 82,688 units in 2023, according to FADA.

Ex-MP Sajjan Kumar convicted in 1984 riots case related to murder of 2 SikhsSajjan Kumar was accused of leading a mob and instigating it to kill Jaswant Singh and his son in Saraswati Vihar area in Delhi during the 1984 anti-Sikh riots.

Sheikh Hasina regime behind possible 'crimes against humanity' during protests: UNThe United Nations report, which is based on an inquiry into the unrest in Bangladesh last year, estimated that around 1,400 protesters were killed, while thousands were injured.

Modi, Trump set for bonhomie, and hard defence bargainingIndia's defence acquisition wishlist is nothing short of ambitious as it accelerates military modernisation to become a self-reliant power in the polarised world

Stock market bloodbath: Should buy the dip, exit or stay invested? The stock market correction has particularly hit retail investors, many of whom are contemplating selling their holdings at a loss. But is that the right move?

L&T chief stirs fresh row with remark on labour crisis: Workers unwilling to moveSpeaking at CII's Mystic South Global Linkages Summit 2025 in Chennai, Subrahmanyan spoke about the difficulties faced by the construction industry in hiring and mobilising workers.

Meat found in Hyderabad temple triggers outrage, BJP questions police probeMeat found inside a temple in Hyderabad sparked outrage among devotees. While the police suspected an animal could have brought it, BJP MLA Raja Singh dismissed the explanation and demanded action.

Vicky Kaushal calls wife Katrina Kaif 'vichitra prani' in adorable videoKatrina Kaif recently shared a delightful video of Vicky Kaushal on Instagram, captioned with his affectionate words for her. The video comes as Vicky is busy promoting his upcoming film 'Chhaava'.

F1 teaser: Brad Pitt promises an exciting summer with sports filmHollywood star Brad Pitt stars in the thrilling promo of the sports film, F1. The short clip sees Pitt racing against time to make it to the finish line.

Vicky Kaushal, Rashmika visit Shirdi Sai Baba temple ahead of Chhaava releaseVicky Kaushal and Rashmika Mandanna visited Shirdi's Sai Baba temple ahead of their big release, Chhaava. Directed by Laxman Utekar, the film is set to hit cinemas on February 14.

Courtney Cox wishes 'beautiful and funny' friend Jennifer Aniston on 56th birthdayHollywood actor Jennifer Aniston is celebrating her 56th birthday today. On the occasion, her dear friend and co-actor Courtney Cox extended a heartwarming wish with an endearing note.

sports.headline: Have India read the pitch wrong? Former selector rues lack of spinners in squadIndia have named 5 spinners their Champions Trophy squad. Given that India will play all of their matches in Dubai, a former selector feels that India might have read the pitch conditions wrong for the ICC tournament.

1st ODI: Asalanka, spinners hand Australia reality check before Champions TrophySri Lanka (SL) vs Australia (AUS), 1st ODI: Chairth Asalanka's sensational hundred helped Sri Lanka recover from 55 for 5 and post 214 in Colombo. Australia, without an array of their A-listers, were undone by the Sri Lankan spin-bowling unit.

Shreyas Iyer continues to own no 4 spot, hammers 64-ball 78 vs England in 3rd ODIStar India batter Shreyas Iyer continued his prolific run at number four spot as he slammed a 64-ball 78 against England during the third ODI in Ahmedabad.

Shubman Gill completes 3-peat in Ahmedabad, joins Babar Azam in rare listShubman Gill continued his form with a stunning century in Ahmedabad on Wednesday, February 12. Gill became the first Indian player to hit centuries in all formats of the game at a single venue.

IND vs ENG: Shubman Gill continues Ahmedabad golden run with 95-ball hundredShubman Gill continued his fine form at the Narendra Modi stadium as he scored a 95-ball hundred. This was Gill's first hundred in the ODI format at the ground as he gave India the upper hand in the game.

Virat Kohli's woes against Adil Rashid continue, falls for 11th time vs spinnerStar India batter Virat Kohli was once again dismissed by Adil Rashid in the third ODI against England at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. It was the 11th time in international cricket that Rashid dismissed Kohli.

Virat Kohli, RCB teammate Livingstone engage in banter after LBW reprieveIndia vs England, 3rd ODI: Virat Kohli and Liam Livingstone were involved in banter after a close LBW call went in the India batter's favour. Kohli hit a fifty in the third ODI in Ahmedabad on Wednesday.

IND vs ENG: Rohit Sharma fails in Ahmedabad ODI after hundred in CuttackRohit Sharma's hopes of carrying his form from the Cuttack ODI was ended by Mark Wood as the England pacer dismissed the Indian captain for just 1 run in Ahmedabad on February 12. Rohit scored a hundred in the second ODI in Cuttack.

In-form Shubman Gill closes in on No.1 ODI spot, Virat slips to No.6The latest ICC Rankings saw four India batters make their way into the top 10 in the ODI rankings. India vice-captain Shubman Gill closed in on the No.1 spot.

Virat Kohli, RCB teammate Livingstone engage in banter after LBW reprieveIndia vs England, 3rd ODI: Virat Kohli and Liam Livingstone were involved in banter after a close LBW call went in the India batter's favour. Kohli hit a fifty in the third ODI in Ahmedabad on Wednesday.

IND vs ENG: Rohit Sharma fails in Ahmedabad ODI after hundred in CuttackRohit Sharma's hopes of carrying his form from the Cuttack ODI was ended by Mark Wood as the England pacer dismissed the Indian captain for just 1 run in Ahmedabad on February 12. Rohit scored a hundred in the second ODI in Cuttack.

In-form Shubman Gill closes in on No.1 ODI spot, Virat slips to No.6The latest ICC Rankings saw four India batters make their way into the top 10 in the ODI rankings. India vice-captain Shubman Gill closed in on the No.1 spot.

Varun Chakravarthy out with niggle as India rest Shami and Ravindra JadejaIndia vs England: India made three changes to their playing XI for the final ODI of the series against England. India rested Ravindra Jadeja and Mohammed Shami, and were forced to leave out Varun Chakravarthy due to an injury.

Kevin Pietersen slams Ben Duckett for bizarre India series remark: Don't seem to careKevin Pietersen has slammed the bizarre remark made by Ben Duckett after their series loss to India. Duckett claimed that he doesn't care about the series loss as long as England goes on to win the Champions Trophy.

3rd ODI LIVE: Arshdeep, Harshit eye early wickets after India 357India (IND) vs England (ENG), 3rd ODI Live updates from Ahmedabad: Arshdeep Singh and Harshit Rana have been handed the new ball. Can India not allow Phil Salt and Ben Duckett to get off to a strong start? Earlier in the day, Shubman Gill's hundred, Shreyas Iyer's 78 and a fifty from Virat Kohli helped India post 357.

Marcus Stoinis slammed by Aaron Finch after shock ODI retirement: Maybe a heads up?Aaron Finch has slammed the decision by Marcus Stoinis to announce his shock retirement from ODIs, just days before the Champions Trophy 2025. Stoinis was initially part of the Australia squad for the tournament.

Are depleted RCB equipped enough to defend crown? WPL 2025: Smriti Mandhana's Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) are the defending champions, but are a tad unsettled due to players pulling out of the competition for various reasons.

Watch: 'Babar, Babar' chants echo at Karachi stadium, leave Pakistan star emotionalFormer captain Babar Azam was met with loud cheers as he spoke during the inaugural ceremony of the newly renovated National Stadium in Karachi. Pakistan will begin their Champions Trophy campaign at this venue on February 19.

Don't bench Kuldeep for Varun in Champions Trophy: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra has urged the Indian team management not to drop Kuldeep Yadav for Varun Chakravarthy during the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Kuldeep has been India's main spinner in the last 2 ICC events.

Australian spinner reported for suspected illegal bowling action Australia's left-arm spinner Matthew Kuhnemann was reported for suspected illegal bowling action after his series-winning performance in Sri Lanka. If found illegal, Kuhnemann will be banned from bowling.

Are depleted RCB equipped enough to defend crown? WPL 2025: Smriti Mandhana's Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) are the defending champions, but are a tad unsettled due to players pulling out of the competition for various reasons.

Watch: 'Babar, Babar' chants echo at Karachi stadium, leave Pakistan star emotionalFormer captain Babar Azam was met with loud cheers as he spoke during the inaugural ceremony of the newly renovated National Stadium in Karachi. Pakistan will begin their Champions Trophy campaign at this venue on February 19.

Don't bench Kuldeep for Varun in Champions Trophy: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra has urged the Indian team management not to drop Kuldeep Yadav for Varun Chakravarthy during the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Kuldeep has been India's main spinner in the last 2 ICC events.

Australian spinner reported for suspected illegal bowling action Australia's left-arm spinner Matthew Kuhnemann was reported for suspected illegal bowling action after his series-winning performance in Sri Lanka. If found illegal, Kuhnemann will be banned from bowling.

Afghanistan's Allah Ghazanfar set to miss Champions Trophy 2025 and IPL due to injuryAfghanistan suffered a big blow ahead of the Champions Trophy 2025 as the young spinner was ruled out of the tournament due to an injury. Ghazanfar will miss the IPL 2025 season due to the injury.

Champions Trophy squad analysis: Smart Bumrah call, baffling spin obsessionA smart decision and quite a few baffling calls contribute to the story of India's team selection for Champions Trophy 2025. Five of their 15 players are spinners while a young Yashasvi Jaiswal was left out after a failed experiment in the ongoing ODI series against England.

Manchester City boss Guardiola struggles to explain late collapse vs Real MadridManchester City boss Pep Guardiola struggled to find words to explain his side's late collapse against Real Madrid in the Round Of 16 qualifier of the UEFA Champions League on February 11. City let a 2-1 lead slip to lose the match 2-3 and hand the advantage to Madrid.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
